body:
## Summary
Adds a custom 404 page that matches the Neovim website design and provides helpful navigation for users who encounter broken links.

fix #382

## Problem
Currently, non-existent URLs on neovim.io show GitHub's default 404 page, which doesn't match the site's branding and doesn't help users navigate back to relevant content.

## Solution
- Created `404.html` using Jekyll's layout system with `{% include nav.html %}`
- Matches the existing Neovim website color scheme and typography
- Includes working navigation header with search functionality
- Provides helpful links to popular pages (Documentation, News, GitHub, etc.)
- Responsive design that works on mobile and desktop
- Includes auto-redirect logic for common typos (docs → doc/, etc.)
- Tracks 404 errors for analytics if available

## Features
- ✅ Uses existing Jekyll layout and includes for consistency
- ✅ Matches Neovim brand colors and styling
- ✅ Responsive design
- ✅ Working navigation header
- ✅ Helpful links to popular pages
- ✅ Auto-redirect for common URL mistakes
- ✅ Analytics tracking support

## Testing
- [x] Tested locally with `jekyll serve` 
- [x] 404 page displays correctly at `/404`
- [x] Uses existing site CSS variables and components
- [x] Mobile responsive design verified

comment_data.body:
why is `error-content` needed? why can't we use the standard section class names. ~~also not clear why 404 is in its own div~~

oh, i see the screenshot in https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/issues/382#issuecomment-3284133829 , it looks good :)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,152 @@ +--- +layout: default +title: Page Not Found +canonical_url: /404.html +--- +{% include nav.html %} +
+
+
+
404
+

Page Not Found

comment_data.body:
why do we need classes defined for this

the entire purpose of CSS is to re-use classes, i don't get why people always define new classes for every single thing
we can drop this, it's redundant with the nav, and the 2 buttons are good enough.

404

The page you're looking for doesn't exist. It might have been moved, deleted, or you entered the wrong URL.

+ +
+ Go Home + Documentation +
+ +
+

Popular Pages

+ Home + News + Documentation + Sponsors + Charter + GitHub

comment_data.body: it tracks 404s for analytics and auto-redirects common typos (/docs → /doc/). but yeah, probably overkill for a simple 404 page. can remove it.
want me to use the existing golden-grid class to constrain it to ~60% width, or just add a max-width on the masthead?

comment_regular_data.body: the css looks over-specific, can it use some of the standard classes/styles from the main css?

> the css looks over-specific, can it use some of the standard classes/styles from the main css?

okay let me try refactoring the CSS.

These are the changes I made. Please let me know if there’s anything else that needs to be done

Replaced custom CSS with existing utilities (`.front-section`, `.container`, `.flex`, `.col3`) and CSS variables (`--accent-color`, `--border-color`).

fixed all of these: - using .masthead instead of custom wrapper - 404 uses existing .lead class - killed the redundant links section - removed error-buttons, just .flex now - basically eliminated all the custom classes also this is how page looks now . should be much cleaner now, let me know if anything else looks off
The color and typewriter style of "404" in https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/issues/382#issuecomment-3284133829 looks better. If that requires a custom css then ok.

> The color and typewriter style of "404" in [#382 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/issues/382#issuecomment-3284133829) looks better. If that requires a custom css then ok.

done, brought back the  typewriter style font for the 404. looks much better now.
this is how it looks now .

> one last nit then lgtm!

awesome, thanks for the patience with all the iterations!
also this is how it looks now after refactoring to golden grid
can the "404" have the color from https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/issues/382#issuecomment-3284133829 instead of the neon green

> can the "404" have the color from [#382 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/issues/382#issuecomment-3284133829) instead of the neon green done , here you go also, let me know if there is anything else to be done .

> Let's try it, thanks!

Many thanks for the review and merge. I’m eager to keep contributing further.

hey @justinmk ,
also i see one issue there , when i do /non-existed page , it still shows me the old github 404 page , why's that

> this is the change we need to do in _layouts/default.html file , so should i open another pr

yes, thanks

title: Add custom 404 page with Neovim branding
